alert.note: Alert for Yell (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 08 at 2:20PM CST until February 10 at 11:17AM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Arkansas... Petit Jean River At Danville affecting Yell County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arkansas... Fourche Lafave River Near Gravelly affecting Yell County. Fourche Lafave River Near Houston affecting Perry County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Fourche Lafave River Near Gravelly. * WHEN...Until late Friday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 22.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 27.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 12 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Crest Time Date Fourche Lafave R Gravelly 24.0 22.8 Wed 1 PM 17.6 7.1 6.1 27.0 12 AM 2/09 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
